name: Robyn
copy: Equality.</br>Empowerment.</br>Hearing the female voice at the same volume as the voice of men.

name: Magdalena
copy: (Swedish def) Feminism betyder lika möjligheter i samhället för både kvinnor och män.</br>Women are people too. End of.

name: Meredith
copy: A previously negative word that needs to be owned as something positive.

name: Mark
copy: A very large subject, and something I don't fully understand.</br>But I think it boils down to treating men and women equally. And thats pretty simple.

name: Rebekah Ford
copy: Not having to think about feminism is feminism to me. Taking for granted that I can be who I am without having to justify it or contextualise it or be judged on how I look, what I say based on my gender.

name: Angi
copy: Indipendant women with an independent mind.

name: Tess
copy: Not easy to describe, it's more about people power! Female or Male, it's about believing in you and equality!
unfairly derided, ridiculed and persecuted for far too long. Would love to proclaim it proudly and not be made to feel like I should apologise for having feminist ideals.
Feminism has evolved from an agressive word that symbolised women's rights to a universal word symbolising rights for everyone.

name: Jade grizzle
copy: Women taking over the world!

name: Catherine Davies
copy: Got lots of strands and is kind of a scary word. Because people can think of bra burning and extream activism.

name: Claire
copy: About fighting for the end of oppression of all women.  There will be no true equality while women's bodies can be bought and sold.

name: Gina Fuller
copy: The belief and active promotion that women and men should be equal in all aspects of life, including equality of opportunity and equal access to resources.

name: Jade Burgoyne
copy: Misunderstood, unexplainable and impossible but open, loving and honest all at the same time. A perfect contridiction of life!

name: Rianna Parker
copy: intersectional, progressive and inclusive or it will be b**ls**t! :)

name: Ava (WOWzers)
copy: Women being just as equall as men. Men can be feminists to!

name: Micky
copy: A long time coming!

name: Kate
copy: The belief that people should be treated equally, no matter what their gender.

name: Lou
copy: Empowerment freedom exhilaration difficult sometimes embarrassing and always never actually about bras

name: Amanda Kendal
copy: Equality. Not the inversion of a perceived situation into its opposite, but equality. That is: equality of opportunity and responsibility and, particularly important, economic equality.
The female equivalent of male chauvinism.

name: Phoebe
copy: A tool we need to use to work towards gender equality. A right and a privilege. A way of looking at the world.

name: Kat
copy: is the belief that women and men everywhere  should be  able to have the same opportunities, experiences, ideas and aspirations.

name: C.H-P
copy: The same now as it was four decades ago... just with more lip gloss.

name: Jemma
copy: Expressing your sexuality without the need for justification, a way of exploring your femininity without comparison, freely enjoying the gender you were born in to.
The fight for equality. Which is kind of sad, seeing as it's 2013. Why aren't we there already?!

name: C.H-P
copy: A concept which rightly aims to provide women with the same opportunities as men but a word which unfortunately reinforces the very inequality it seeks to dissolve.

name: E Holland
copy: The Male Chauvinism is a dressed up phase for sexisms! Suggesting that we are intellectually inferior. Feminism is a pro-active movement to empower equality for women. It seems that “anonymous” dose not have the intellectual capability to see the difference or is that another bigoted sheep conforming to social ignorance?
Something that makes you want to talk about independence, equality and power but I think it's more about respect. Respect for what women do and the sacrifices they make.

name: Annie May
copy: 'The radical notion that women are people.' A movement striving for the fair and equal representation of women, that should include, and also benefit men.
